revised_title: Morphology, Development, and Taxonomic Status of Xyloplax: A New Species in the Echinodermata Class Concentricycloidea
tldr: The article describes the morphology, development, and taxonomic status of Xyloplax, a unique class of echinoderms in the Concentricycloidea group. The study examines two species and provides a detailed account of their observations and conclusions, confirming the status of the class Concentricycloidea. The research also discusses recent attempts to reclassify the Echinodermata.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Echinodermata
